SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Oats relative to the peak of Corn in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Oats is to the {left} of the peak of Corn.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Corn show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Corn shows a {Periodic fluctuation}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Corn} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =2957.9?
EVJ.A: At X =2957.9,the label with the highest density is {Oats}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 2957? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Corn}'s peak at {4144},{Wheat}'s peak at {4244},{Soybeans}'s peak at {3969},{Barley}'s peak at {4294},{Rice}'s peak at {4438},{Oats}'s peak at {3453}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 2578? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Oats or Barley?
NC.A: {Barley} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Soybeans or Barley?
NC.A: {Barley} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Barley or Corn?
NC.A: {Barley} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {6} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Rice}
